meanings.definition: To give a wrong color to.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally miscolored the sky purple instead of blue.
meanings.sent2: The artist didn't mean to miscolor the tree green instead of brown.
meanings.sent3: The child's attempt to miscolor the grass pink made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions seemed to miscolor the room with a sense of unease.
meanings.sent5: The sunset miscolored the clouds with vibrant shades of orange and pink.

meanings.sent1: He tends to miscolor his drawings by using the wrong shades.
meanings.sent2: The printer miscolored the document, making the text hard to read.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally miscolored the icing on the cake, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent4: Her biased opinions miscolored her perception of reality.
meanings.sent5: The fog miscolored the landscape, giving it an eerie appearance.
